{{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-260-01-A |Item_parent=Hematuria |Item_parent_short=Hematuria |Rank=A |Title=Know the definition of haematuria |Description=None |Rubric=Definition |Contributors=Charles Dariane, Bruno Moulin |Order=1}}
*Haematuria is the abnormal presence of red blood cells in the urine. *This is a major warning sign: rule out serious underlying pathology (bladder tumours|urothelial tumour 314). *It must be confirmed by a quantitative urinary cytological examination (ECBU: ≥ 10 red blood cells/mm3 or ≥ 10,000 red blood cells/mL). ==Differential diagnosis:== *urethrorrhagia'': bleeding from the urethra, outside micturition. *red colouring of the urine: medicines, pigments, food, urate crystals in the form of crystals in nappies, etc. *blood contamination of urine'': menstrual bleeding, metrorrhagia, haemospermia, etc.

properties.question: What is the definition of haematuria?
properties.option_a: The presence of red blood cells in the urine without any other visible signs of injury.
properties.option_b: The presence of red blood cells in the urine with visible signs of injury, such as bleeding from the urethra.
